title: 'I'll work 100-hour weeks to clear our Covid debt'
description: Businesses have run up an "unprecedented" amount of debt in the pandemic, say industry groups.

title: Travel industry anger as Germans flock to Majorca
description: The bosses of two travel firms say the Balearic islands should be on the green list for safe travel.

title: Why the cruise industry is still navigating choppy waters
description: The global cruise line industry is hoping to now recover from the pandemic, but problems remain.

title: Covid causes new environmental dilemma for India’s Ganges River
description: Hundreds of bodies have been buried in shallow graves along the banks of the already-polluted Ganges.

title: Australia's growing thirst for alcohol-free wine and beer
description: Demand for non-alcoholic drinks "explodes" as more Australians rethink their drinking habits.

title: Delta variant: Fact-checking claims about Covid and borders
description: Claims about whether the UK border policy contributed to the spread of the Delta Covid variant dominated Prime Minister's Questions.

title: Iran's presidential election: Four claims fact-checked
description: TV debate topics included censorship, Iran's economic performance and political prisoners.

title: Jabs to be compulsory for England care home staff
description: Workers are expected be given 16 weeks to have the jab - or risk losing their job, the BBC understands.

title: Boris Johnson called health secretary hopeless in WhatsApp message - Dominic Cummings
description: The PM's former aide launches a fresh tirade in his war of words with Health Secretary Matt Hancock.

title: Celtic to face Denmark's Midtjylland in Champions League qualifying
description: Celtic will face Danish runners-up Midtjylland in the second qualifying round of the Champions League.

title: Nóra Quoirin death: Inquest ruling changed to open verdict
description: A judge alters the inquest verdict in the death of the 15-year-old who went missing in a Malaysian jungle.

title: England v India: 'A mighty blow!' England's Lauren Winfield-Hill hits big six
description: Opener Lauren Winfield-Hill launches Pooja Vastrakar's delivery for six during day one of the Test between England and India at the Bristol County Ground

title: Barbara Windsor's Carry on Camping bikini sells for £9,500
description: The swimsuit, worn by the late actress in a famous Carry on Camping scene, raises money for charity.

title: Woman overjoyed at birth of great-great-great-grandchild in Edinburgh
description: The mother-of-eight has one of the only families in the UK with six generations alive at the same time.

title: Fury v Wilder III: Tyson Fury and Deontay Wilder preview third fight
description: WBC world heavyweight champion Tyson Fury and American challenger Deontay Wilder's press conference, to preview their third fight on 24 July in Las Vegas, was a little unusual.

title: Covid: Deaf campaigner takes legal action over No 10 briefings
description: The government is accused of breaching the Equality Act by failing to provide sign language interpreters.

title: Ex-England captain reunites with dad with Parkinson's
description: The year Mike Tindall won the Rugby World Cup was the same year his father received his diagnosis.

title: Champions Man City face Spurs - who do your team play on Premier League opening weekend?
description: Champions Manchester City face a testing trip to Spurs on the opening weekend of the new Premier League season.

title: Israel strikes in Gaza after fire balloons launched
description: It is the first major flare-up since a ceasefire ended a conflict between Israel and Hamas in May.

title: Boy, 9, writes plea to PM for epileptic brother's cannabis treatment
description: Thomas Braun's younger brother has up to 100 epileptic seizures a day.

title: Man charged after BBC reporter chased by protesters
description: A clip shared on social media shows demonstrators haranguing BBC Newsnight reporter Nicholas Watt.

title: Sign up for the BBC Sport app
description: With latest scores and headlines sent straight to your device, personalisation and much more, ensure you have a great sporting life with BBC Sport.

title: UK warned it is unprepared for climate chaos
description: Homes need to be more resilient and the government is in a worse position than five years ago, report says.

title: Covid: How have allotments helped people during the pandemic?
description: Plot-holders tell how growing their own has helped them deal with grief and sustain mental health.

title: Another life-saving Covid treatment found
description: Monoclonal antibody therapy, given by drip, can save some of the sickest hospital patients.

title: Duke's death left giant-sized hole in our lives - Sophie
description: In an interview, the Countess of Wessex says the Covid pandemic made it harder to support the Queen.

title: The Papers: 'No green light to jab kids' and Met police 'rotten'
description: Delays to vaccinations for children and mandatory jabs for care home staff feature on the front pages.

title: British music exports reach a record high
description: Artists like Dua Lipa, Coldplay and The Beatles help the British music industry make £500m overseas.

title: 'I was humiliated': The continuing trauma of South Korea's spy cam victims
description: Survivors have faced threats and bullying from police when seeking justice, says a new rights report.

title: ‘I got PTSD after witnessing my daughter’s birth’
description: After the distressing birth of his daughter, Elliott Rae struggled with post traumatic stress disorder.

title: Euro 2020: Scotland fan visits streets named after every player
description: 20-year-old David visits 26 streets around the UK that share a name with a Scotland footballer.

title: Tracking change in Ethiopia and the challenges ahead
description: The BBC charts the dramatic changes and challenges facing the country as it goes to the polls.

title: Biden: How Europeans have reacted to president's visit
description: Three prominent Europeans assess how Joe Biden's talks with European leaders have gone.

title: 'People didn't believe my CV', says board director
description: Women still face difficulties getting onto boards at smaller firms, according to research.

title: Brexit: Can the UK and the EU reach a deal on Northern Ireland?
description: How might the UK and EU compromise on the Northern Ireland protocol?

title: CEO Secrets: 'I started my firm for under £500 as a bet'
description: Snack boss Nick Coleman started his firm for under £500 as a bet. It now turns over £6m a year.

title: 'I never dreamed I was entitled to benefits'
description: Older people facing poverty are urged to claim Pension Credit - a gateway to further financial help.
